[

Social Media and Content Manager

Company Name frank green Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 1,308 views

Job description

SOCIAL MEDIA + CONTENT MANAGER


At frank green we want to change the world. No, really - we do. We want to motivate a change in how you think, feel and (most importantly) do, regarding sustainable living. \xa0We want to help reduce the waste we are leaving for generations to come and believe prevention is better than cure.

\xa0

If that's something you feel passionate about, we have an opportunity for a highly creative, results driven Social Media and Content Manager to join our team. Working directly with the Head of Digital & Marketing you will contribute to the social media and content strategy of the frank green business, while creating innovative and engaging content each day that resonates with our loyal community, across our multiple platforms, both on and offsite.

\xa0

This role will allow you to explore your creativity and try new things all while capturing the beautiful aesthetic and innovative and sustainable nature of the frank green brand and product range.

\xa0

The successful Social Media and Content Manager will have a proven track record of creating engaging content and managing communities in either a lifestyle, sustainability or design industry.

\xa0

\xa0


ABOUT THE ROLE:

\xa0

Working across our global brand, you will be responsible for:

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Content creation for all frank green online media channels, including (but not limited to) Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter and EDMs.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Editorial responsibility for the frank green blog and press channels on frankgreen.com, both locally and across our international presences.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Customer service support (direct dialogue with consumers across our social channels).

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Development, execution and optimisation of the frank green social media strategy.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Campaign management from ideation through to generation and execution.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Weekly reporting of social and traffic KPI’s.


\xa0

To be successful in this role you will:


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ideally have 5+ years' experience in content creation and community management \xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Have demonstrated experience in writing rich and engaging content for an international brand

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Be mature, self-motivated and have the ability to take initiative

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Have high attention to detail with the ability to self check

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Love working in a challenging, dynamic environment

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Are an autonomous self-starter who knows how to get things done

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Want to work in a team and collaborate with others

\xa0

The below skills and traits will be highly regarded:


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Graphic design skills/experience (Adobe Creative Suite or Canva)

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Big picture thinker who is well travelled.\xa0 Bonus points if you've worked in either the US or UK markets.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Understanding of people and the world’s challenges

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 A cross section of experience across client side and agency


\xa0

This is an opportunity for someone who can work in a fast-paced environment and get their hands dirty to get the job done.

\xa0

In exchange for your hard work, we’ll offer you autonomy and a supportive ‘anything is possible’ culture in our South Melbourne office.

\xa0

If this sounds like you, please send your CV, an example of your work and cover letter to hello@frankgreen.com.au.

\xa0




WE’RE FRANK GREEN, DESIGNED FOR HUMANITY.

At frank green, we want to change the way people think about reusable products. It’s our mission to motivate them to live more sustainably and reduce unnecessary waste.

frank green’s philosophy is to design stylish, innovative products – because we believe everyday products should be beautiful, functional and good for the environment.

\xa0

Our team culture is dynamic, fast-paced and high performing. We aren’t afraid of change and believe that anything is possible. We love being pushed outside our comfort zone and being challenged. We’re always innovating, looking for any opportunity to put our customers first. We’re also a super friendly bunch who love coffee - our office is a short walk to Clarendon Street, with easy access to public transport.

\xa0

Contact the job poster

frank green

frank green’s mission is to stop the devastating environmental impact of single-use products.

Melbourne, Australia

839196362:
[

Logistics Operations Manager

Company Name Logical Executive Solutions Pty Ltd Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 528 views

Job description

  • Event Industry Local and International
  • Newly Created Position
  • Based in Ivanhoe


A leading Freight Forwarder in Australia’s exciting Events Industry is looking for an experienced Logistics Operations Manager. They service a wide range of events across the country including Exhibitions, Conferences and Outdoor Events.


This is an exciting time to join a young and growing organisation where the opportunity to grow with the business and share in its growth will be your reward.


This is a new position which will be responsible for:


  • Working with Account Managers and determining labour, equipment and other resources required to deliver projects;
  • Management and scheduling of supervisors, forklift drivers and labour;
  • Management and scheduling of equipment, forklifts, cranes;
  • Management of equipment and labour suppliers;
  • Working onsite at various events and venues throughout Australia, most events are in Melbourne, Sydney and Gold Coast/Brisbane;
  • Liaising with freight and transport co-ordinators assisting to ensure on-time delivery to and collection from events;
  • WHS/OHS Management;


Whilst experience in a similar role is essential, prior event industry experience is not mandatory. The necessary training and development will be provided to ensure your success.


The ideal candidate will be eager to learn, be a self-starter who is very well organised. A high attention to detail, excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the proven ability and willingness to get out and build relationships in the industry sector.


The company strictly adhere to WHS/OHS obligations as required by law and promote a fun, yet productive working environment.


If you require further information please contact Caroline Taylor at Logical Executive Solutions on (03) 8620 2807.\xa0

838980046:
[

Compliance Manager

Company Name Company Location 120 Collins Street , Melbourne, VIC 3006, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 150 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

BetEasy is the most sophisticated and rewarding wagering operator in its class. Built on a powerful partnership with The Stars Group, we are well on our journey to be the number one wagering operator by 2020, delivered through excellent people, process and technology within an innovative and dynamic culture.

To help us on that journey, we’re looking for a Compliance Manager\xa0to join our Strategy & Regulatory Affairs team. Reporting to our Head of Legal & Compliance, your role is critical in ensuring our compliance with a range of laws and license conditions.
\xa0\xa0
About the ROLE:
Working with all the key regulatory bodies and internal teams, this role focuses on ensuring BetEasy’s compliance with Anti-Money Laundering/Counter-Terrorism Financing (AML/CTF) laws, Northern Territory Racing Commission (NTRC) licence conditions and other applicable laws and policies across the business. Key accountabilities include but aren’t limited to:
  • Managing BetEasy’s AML/CTF Program, including reporting, internal reviews and testing, independent reviews and seeking relevant approvals for amendments
  • Ensuring that each business unit complies with the requirements under its AML/CTF Program
  • Providing business with updates to any changes to AML/CTF laws legislation/regulation/AUSTRAC interpretations
  • Adopt responsibility for BetEasy's compliance with NTRC imposed licence conditions
  • Owning BetEasy's relationship with the NTRC and Licensing NT
  • Helping build, implement and manage BetEasy’s Compliance Program
  • Conducting regular audits to ensure the Program is working properly
  • Conducting targeted, relevant training as required across the business
  • Alerting the leadership team if there are any issues or risks to ensure appropriate action is taken
  • Overseeing the response to law enforcement and sports and racing integrity requests.
\xa0\xa0
About YOU:
This is a broad role with impact across all areas of the company. We are looking for someone who is personable, innovative and collaborative. If you have the following skills and experience we’d love to hear from you:
  • Experience building, implementing and maintaining a Compliance Program
  • AML/CTF experience
  • Ability to interpret and understand grey areas
  • Ability to apply technical rules to real life situations
  • Risk assessment capabilities
  • Excellent communication skills & stakeholder management capabilities
  • Project management skills
  • Bachelor’s degree with a legal or compliance aspect would be viewed favourably
  • Team oriented
In return for your hard work we have a number of benefits and initiatives to support you personally and professionally including but not limited to 5 weeks’ annual leave, a discounted MYKI, Lunch ‘n’ Learn sessions, matched charity donations and, as the official wagering partner to the AFL, there are heaps of opportunities to catch a game or two!

Why BetEasy?
BetEasy was recognised as an Employer of Choice by The Australian Business Awards 2017. With teams in Darwin, Melbourne and Sydney, we’re passionate about what we do and proud of our unique heritage and entrepreneurial spirit. We work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that push the limits of our customers' expectations. With brilliant minds and a vibrant culture, the sky’s the limit! Our environment is supportive and friendly, we encourage innovation, collaboration and creative thinking. If you thrive on being challenged and enjoy working in a fast-paced stimulating environment, come and join us on this incredible journey.

To find more about BetEasy please visit https://workatbeteasy.com.au/

Disclaimer: BetEasy does not accept unsolicited agency resumes.

Territory Sales Manager

Company Name Flex Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 76 views

Job description

The Territory Sales Manager will be based in Melbourne, Australia. This position has full revenue responsibility for their prospective territory. In addition, the Sales and Lead Territory Sales Manager will manage the sale of Flex's products and services to specific existing and future key channel partners on a national or geographic basis.

We Are Looking For Someone Who Demonstrates
  • Intense collaboration
  • Good communication skills
  • Thoughtful, fast, disciplined execution
  • Tenacious commitment to continuous improvement

Here Is a Glimpse Of What You’ll Do
  • Achieve Quarterly Sales, Margin, Cancelation and AR targets
  • Plan, design and implement sales and development activities to grow direct revenue
  • Enhance existing and establish new partners
  • Further and primarily lead sales and business development activities to drive revenue
  • Control and maintain gross margins through sales support
  • Produce/review monthly, sales and activity reports to monitor milestone achievements and ensure key metrics are met
  • Manage compliance and ensure Sales Partners are following Flex’s policies and guidelines
  • Be responsible for training and on boarding new partners
  • Train, lead and support peers and management to upskill overall business knowledge and grow sales and installation capability
  • Train partner’s personnel and assist with sales of Flex Energy Solutions’ products
  • Lead cross divisional teams and/or projects and/or campaigns to positively impact the organization’s long-term goals and objectives for success
  • Develop and manage relations with business and partners to drive new business opportunities and grow existing business partnerships

Here Is Some Of What You’ll Need (required)
  • 5-8 years of relevant experience in the Sales function, preferably with exposure in MNC within the Solar or Energy industry
  • Degree in the related field (or Diploma holder with proven years of work experience)
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills

Here Are a Few Of Our Preferred Experiences
  • Good team player who is self-motivated, independent and has ability to exercise independent judgment in complex situations
  • Good communication skills
  • People-oriented
  • Detailed and meticulous

Mid-Senior level

  • Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

Your career In Accenture Products

Technology Consulting - Retail Finance Manager

Accenture Products Group

Our Products Group brings together people with first-class consultancy skills and specialist industry expertise. You will develop a career working across a range of industries including legal, retail, consumer goods and services, automotive, infrastructure and travel. To join us here you’ll need the sharp thinking to solve complex business problems and provide deep industry insight and technological know-how on a global level. The scope of the role, exposure to clients and cutting-edge technologies will provide an ideal platform to develop your consulting career.

Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.

Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career, where with 4 women on Leadership Council and 36% global workforce women are and want to continue to grow.

People in our Client & Market career track drive profitable growth by developing market-relevant insights to increase market share or create new markets. They progress through required promotion into market-facing roles that have a direct impact on sales

We are looking for an experienced finance and digital finance technology consulting managers, with solid SAP Financials background to help our clients navigate their digital transformation journey.

  • Be able to articulate the business value drivers for digital transformation
  • Architect IT roadmap and best practice finance processes and
  • Blueprint Finance Technology Solutions to enable our clients’ business strategy.

    • Reviewing and analyzing the client’s financial operations and processes and recommending improvements and help our clients achieve clear business goals.

    • Document the customers’ business needs through to implementation/configuration

    • Leveraging our global network of Accenture professionals to strengthen your client prepositions and recommendations

      • Preferred Skills & Experience
      • Bachelor’s Degree is required, MBA is highly regarded
      • Deep knowledge of best practice finance processes – across general ledger accounting, cost management, receivable and payables, reporting, product and project costing, and profitability analysis domains, retail pricing processes.
      • An ability to articulate and clearly communicate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical and impactful manner
      • Deep knowledge of SAP and S4/HANA Financial – GL, Receivables and Payables, Asset Accounting, Central Finance, Financial Organisational Structures and master data.
      • Experienced in Technology Assessment & Vendor Selection.
      • Experienced in Solution Architecting and ERP Blueprinting
      • Defining Value Case for ERP Transformation and Technology Roadmaps
      • Consumer Goods and Retail Industry Experience
      • End to end ERP Lifecycle Experience
      • Experience working through organizational change, with a demonstrated track record of continuing responsibilities, creativity and innovation, including evidence of solution design.
      • Well-developed analytical skills and the ability to provide clarity to complex issues, and synthesize large amounts of information.
      • An ability to identify the root causes of issues by analysing patterns and trends.
      • A desire to deliver to a high standard in a suitable timeframe.
      • Self-motivating, adaptable, able to prioritize and able to inspire and motivate others.
      • Manage large - medium sized teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture
      • Excellent communication (verbal, written and presentation) and interpersonal skills
        • Nice to have
        • CPA certification
        • New IT Experiences – RPA, Central Finance, IFRS Standards
        • Finance, Sales, digital pricing, Business Planning and Consolidation Experience
        • Oracle experience.
